TopicTitle: What is the first building you blew up?

Articles.Content: So I ask what building did you explode first(in any save I don't care) for me I exploded the flagpole after driving into it. What did you explode first
I haven't blown anything up.
Launchpad, trying to launch an humongously heavy craft...
The VAB, of course.  Then I pulled out Whack-A-Kerbal and blew the rest of it up.  That was a good day.
The VAB.  Experimenting with the new parts and destructible buildings when they first appeared,  'for science' naturally.
The VAB. It may or may not have been on purpose...

I launched a fair number of ships of a variety of designs, and then blew up the VAB, SPH, and most of the rest of the KSC, then attempted to do as many missions as possible with the ships I already had.
I've never blown up any building.
I've only ever blown up the launch pad when it couldn't handle one of my rockets.  I then proceeded to turn on indestructible buildings.
No idea. Probably the launchpad though, that's easy to blow up by accident or on purpose. The top tier VAB seems pretty tough sometimes, but then other times you tap it and it goes boom.

I blown up the launchpad and the VAB on a single launch on tech level 0. Though it was a challenge I came up with, but didn't get a single entry. Don't think I ever destroyed any building unintentionally.

Funny you should mention it, I blew up my first building on purpose for my fan-fiction project just a couple days ago... it was great fun to watch!!!

 

Good times.... gooooooooood times....... 

Edited December 27, 2015 by Just Jim
Launchpad, just from spawning a big rocket on it. Turned off building destruction after that, haven't looked back.

Launchpad.  Touchdown at 5m/s is more than Kerbal concrete can handle. (What RIC and others said)

Edited December 27, 2015 by Pecan

The little fuel storage thingie in front of the VAB. I was trying to smash the VAB but didn't have enough speed and a little chunk of rocket spiraled off into the fuel storage thingie.

I later pulled out a behemoth to drop onto the VAB.

The VAB.

Testing a stock surface to air missile installation I was fooling with.

I had known blowing up the buildings was possible but never actually did it until I shot a missile at it, I must admit I was impressed by the spectacle as it crumbled into pieces and exploded. I was also surprised the rather small stock missile I built was enough to do the job lol.

Landing pad.... I just put my rocket on it to launch it.... BOOM !

I was like... wtf?   then I remembered, destructible buildings now with new patch... riiiight.
So I took the habit of putting bracers to hold my rockets in the air before launching; thing I rarely did before that patch.
The launchpad. On the first day I played KSP, I launched a heavy rocket and cut its engines.

The Airport.

 

Reasons.

6 hours ago, 322997am said:

So I ask what building did you explode first(in any save I don't care) for me I exploded the flagpole after driving into it. What did you explode first

The SPH, because my "Hellraiser" tank firing salvos of Kickback SRBs was spawned on the runway and the SPH required zero elevation change and the least azimuth change to hit.

Edited December 27, 2015 by Geschosskopf

The flagpole.  That version of my first vertical take off space plane did not make it to space.  Nor did its successor make it back down.  It clipped the last ridge before the runway.  But the crew compartment and Jeb survived!
I really did not think it could happen. I have had so many launches where I went straight up and nothing got hit. Until today. The VAB was hit and I needed to repair it.

In sandbox, countless aircraft have hit the fuel tanks next to the SPH, but I reverted after each catastrophe. In a more successful flight recently, I snagged a runway light during an out-of-control takeoff before safely flying away (because my biggest struggle with SSTOs is the landing gear design).

I'm in the camp whose first exploded building was the launch pad, upon loading a heavy rocket onto it.  Rather than disable building destruction, I just started using launch clamps to make sure that my over-sized constructions don't sit on their engines.

None intentionnaly, yet, in ksp ; ) just a small plane landing fail on the runaway, but not much dmg.

Edited December 28, 2015 by WinkAllKerb''
